title: 4-4-4 Breathing for Bedtime
summary: A short breathing routine to calm your nervous system before sleep.
steps: Lie down comfortably or sit with your back supported.
Breathe in slowly for 4 seconds.
Hold gently for 4 seconds.
Exhale slowly for 4 seconds.
Repeat the cycle 5–8 times, focusing on the breath.

title: Wind-Down Routine (30 minutes)
summary: Create a gentle routine that tells your body it’s time to rest.
steps: Dim the lights and reduce screen use at least 30 minutes before bed.
Make a warm (non-caffeinated) drink like herbal tea.
Do light stretching or progressive muscle relaxation for 5–7 minutes.
Write a quick 2–3 line gratitude note or a brief to-do list for tomorrow.

title: Bedroom Rituals for Better Sleep
summary: Small environmental changes that help your brain associate bed with sleep.
steps: Keep your bedroom cool, dark, and quiet — use earplugs or a white-noise app if needed.
Reserve the bed for sleep and rest (avoid working or studying in bed).
Use calming colors, soft bedding, and a comfortable pillow.
If you can, get 15–20 minutes of morning sunlight exposure daily to regulate your circadian rhythm.

title: Progressive Muscle Relaxation (10 minutes)
summary: A guided practice to release tension from head to toe.
steps: Lie down and take three slow, deep breaths.
Tense the muscles in your toes for 5 seconds, then release.
Move up to calves, thighs, abdomen, chest, hands, arms, shoulders, neck, and face — tense then release each group.
Notice the contrast between tension and relaxation as you go.

title: Limit Stimulants & Screen Time
summary: Simple lifestyle adjustments that improve sleep quality over time.
steps: Avoid caffeine in the late afternoon and evening (tea, coffee, energy drinks).
Avoid heavy meals and vigorous exercise within 2–3 hours of bedtime.
If you must use screens, enable a warm-night filter and lower brightness.
Try a short walk earlier in the evening to help tire the body gently.

title: If You Can’t Sleep: The 20-Minute Rule
summary: A gentle strategy to avoid anxious nights when sleep doesn’t come.
steps: If you haven’t fallen asleep within 20 minutes, get out of bed.
Do a calm, low-light activity (reading a paper book, light stretching) in another room.
Return to bed only when you feel sleepy.
Repeat if necessary — avoid checking the time or your phone.

title: Sleep Journal (track patterns)
summary: Record simple sleep details to identify helpful routines and triggers.
steps: Note bedtime and wake time each day.
Record naps, caffeine intake, exercise, and mood before bed.
After a week, look for patterns: which habits helped or harmed sleep.
Share the journal with a clinician if you seek professional help.

title: Gentle Evening Mindfulness
summary: A short mindfulness practice to settle the mind before sleep.
steps: Sit or lie comfortably and focus on your breath.
Notice thoughts as they come, label them gently ('thinking') and return to the breath.
If your mind wanders, guide it back without judgment.
Practice for 5–10 minutes, then allow yourself to drift into sleep.
